Title: Load analysis on the bridge structure according to RSNI T 02-2005 and SNI 1725-2006
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Civil Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Rachmat, F., Civil Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hidayat, I., Civil Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The rapid development of infrastructure in civil engineering must be compensated with the latest regulations to adapt to the current conditions, especially in the construction of bridge infrastructure, and therefore the government issued the latest loading regulation on bridge structure that is SNI 1725-2016. The bridge is important because it serves as a liaison between two separate places due to several conditions. This research is conducted to find out whether existing bridge can still meet the criteria of stress, deflection, and deformation based on load value factor, load action, and load combination on SNI 1725-2016. The earthquake load used is a response spectrum using SNI 2833: 2013 regulations[1]. This research uses finite element method using software midas civil software program. In this analysis it is found that the value of stress, deflection, and deformation on the bridge structure according to SNI 1725-2016 is greater than RSNI T 02-2005. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
